text: "Goosebumps" (stylized in all lowercase) is a song by American rapper Travis Scott, featuring vocals from fellow American rapper Kendrick Lamar. It was sent to rhythmic radio on December 13, 2016 by Grand Hustle Records and Epic Records as the third single from Scott's second studio album Birds in the Trap Sing McKnight. On October 12, 2018, the soundtrack for the film The Hate U Give featured the song. Following the release of Scott and fellow American rapper and his influence Kid Cudi's April 2020 chart-topping single "The Scotts", the song – along with Scott's August 2018 single "Sicko Mode", from his third studio album Astroworld – experienced a resurgence in streams and sales, achieving chart debuts or new peaks in multiple countries, including Australia, France, Germany, Italy and Switzerland. ==Background== When Travis Scott was doing an interview with Billboard about the album and how he linked with Kendrick Lamar for "Goosebumps" he said: ==Music video== The music video was released on April 3, 2017 exclusively on Apple Music. It was directed by BRTHR, who also directed a similar music video for The Weeknd's "Party Monster". ==Chart performance== "Goosebumps" debuted at number 92 on the US Billboard Hot 100 for the week of September 24, 2016. The song then re-entered the chart several times and peaked at number 32 on the chart, becoming his third top 40 hit. In January 2017, the song was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) for sales of over 500,000 equivalent-units in the United States. On March 28, 2017, Travis announced that the song has been certified Platinum. ==Live performances== On January 21, 2017, Travis Scott performed "Goosebumps" on Jimmy Kimmel Live. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2016–20) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| Australia (ARIA) | 45 |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| France (SNEP) | 23 |- |- ! scope="row"| Global 200 (Billboard) | 108 |- ! scope="row"| Global Excl. US (Billboard) | 119 |- ! scope="row"| Greece (IFPI Greece) | 79 |- |- ! scope="row"| Ireland (IRMA) | 65 |- ! scope="row"| Italy (FIMI) | 12 |- ! scope="row"| Lithuania (AGATA) | 39 |- |- |- ! scope="row"| Spain (PROMUSICAE) | 51 |- ! scope="row"| Sweden (Sverigetopplistan) | 46 |- |- |- |- |- |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2017) ! scope="col"| Position |- ! scope="row"| US Billboard Hot 100 | 68 |- ! scope="row"| US Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs (Billboard) | 60 |- ! scope="row"| US Rhythmic (Billboard) | 30 |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2018) ! scope="col"| Position |- ! scope="row"| Portugal (AFP) | 102 |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2019) ! scope="col"| Position |- ! scope="row"| Portugal (AFP) | 128 |} ==Certifications== ==Radio and release history== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col"| Country ! scope="col"| Date ! scope="col"| Format ! scope="col"| Label ! scope="col"| |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | United States | December 13, 2016 | Rhythmic contemporary | rowspan="2" | | align="center"| |- | January 24, 2017 | Contemporary hit radio | align="center"| |} == Covers == American singer Skylar Grey released a cover of the song with a new beat on May 29, 2020. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:2016 songs Category:2016 singles Category:Grand Hustle Records singles Category:Epic Records singles Category:Songs written by Travis Scott Category:Kendrick Lamar songs Category:Songs written by Kendrick Lamar Category:Songs written by Mike Dean (record producer) Category:Song recordings produced by Cardo (record producer) Category:Song recordings produced by Cubeatz Category:Travis Scott songs Category:Songs written by Kevin Gomringer Category:Songs written by Tim Gomringer Category:Songs written by Cardo (record producer)
